title: Drawing, "A Votive Image of a Boy Presented by his Parents to St. Nicholas of Bari", late 18th century
medium: Brush and brown and gray wash, pen and brown ink on paper
markings: incomplete watermark:  upper part of a heart with  A M G; cross above
provenance: From the collection of Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The Saint is sitting on clouds, with book and three balls, blessing.  Surrounded by angels, two of them with mitre and crozier.  Below, at left:  The father standing, mother and son kneeling.  At right a tub surrounded by three children.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "A Votive Image of a Boy Presented by his Parents to St. Nicholas of Bari", late 18th century.
late 18th century. Brush and brown and gray wash, pen and brown ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4374.
